TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , was a NORP national who was born in DATE , lived in GPE and died on DATE . She was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant inherited a plot of land located in GPE , GPE . In DATE the local community made many investments to turn the area into a district park . On DATE she applied to ORG ( PERSON ) for information concerning construction on her plot . In reply , she was informed that according to the local master plan of DATE ( plan zagospodarowania przestrzennego ) her plot was situated in an area designated for housing construction on forest grounds and had a forestry zone status . On DATE the applicant lodged an application for a construction permit . Her application was dismissed on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE , upon the applicant ’s appeal , this decision was quashed . On the same date the Mayor of PERSON ( PERSON ) stayed the proceedings concerning construction on the applicant ’s plot pending the termination of proceedings relating to divesting the area of its forestry zone status . According to the new local master plan of DATE , the applicant ’s plot was situated in an area designated for housing construction and community green spaces . It was possible to construct a house on the plot ; however , only after the plot had been divested of its forestry zone status . In addition the surface area of the house could not exceed PERCENT of the total area of the plot .

In DATE the GPE began work on the plot with a view to preserving its district park function . On DATE the applicant requested the Municipality to discontinue the work on her property . On DATE she was informed that the Municipality was considering buying the plots situated in the park area .

On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with the GPE Governor ( PERSON ) alleging inactivity on the part of the first - instance authority ( as regards the proceedings concerning the divesting of the forestry zone status ) . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG ( GPE PERSON ) and asked that her plot be divested of its forestry zone status . On DATE the applicant asked for the proceedings to be expedited .

On DATE the Municipality recommended granting the applicant ’s application : that the plot in question be divested of its forestry zone status . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was informed that the Governor ’s office had not supported the GPE ’s recommendation .

Upon the applicant ’s further enquiries , on DATE the GPE Governor informed her that CARDINAL of the reasons for rejecting the recommendation was that a group of CARDINAL people had protested against any construction being carried out on the applicant ’s plot and the adjacent plots .
On DATE the GPE lodged a motion with the Minister of ORG ( Minister PERSON , PERSON i GPE ) concerning the alteration of the use of the applicant ’s plot .
On DATE an analysis of the legal and factual circumstances of the applicant ’s and other ORG cases was prepared .

On DATE the Mayor of PERSON ( PERSON ) informed the applicant that according to the provisions of the Act of DATE on environmental protection , the competent authority to buy the applicant ’s plot was ORG ( FAC ) . Consequently , on DATE the applicant ’s case was transferred to ORG .
On DATE the applicant ’s daughter asked ORG to be allowed to use the plot for construction purposes .
On DATE ORG considered that LAW did not apply and therefore it transferred the case back to ORG .

On DATE , DATE and DATE , CARDINAL May and DATE the applicant applied to the Mayor of GPE asking for a speedy conclusion to her case . She further requested the Mayor to buy the plot from her . During the whole period , the applicant ’s plot was used as a park .

On DATE the applicant ’s daughter notified GPE that she wished to put up temporary fencing around her plot . On DATE the applicant was informed that her application to alter the use of the plot had been rejected .

On DATE the applicant asked the Municipality to grant a planning permission ( decyzja o warunkach zabudowy i zagospodarowania terenu ) . On DATE the Mayor gave a decision authorising the applicant to construct a house and a sanitary tank on her plot . The Mayor further held that it was necessary to obtain permission from the Minister of ORG in order to alter the use of the applicant ’s plot as specified in the local master plan that is , from a forestry zone to a residential and construction zone .
On DATE the applicant applied to the Mayor of GPE requesting the commencement of the procedure for the alteration of the use of her plot in the local master plan .

On DATE the applicant was informed that a certain group “ ORG ” ( ORG ) ( “ the ORG ” ) had appealed against the grant of planning permission of DATE . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) upheld the planning permission . On DATE the ORG lodged a complaint with ORG .

On DATE the applicant filed a complaint under LAW with ORG of Appeal alleging inactivity on the part of GPE as regards the proceedings to alter the use of her plot . On DATE the Municipality explained that on DATE the applicant ’s case had been transferred to the Minister of ORG and therefore the GPE was no longer competent to deal with the applicant ’s case .

On DATE the ORG transferred the applicant ’s case to the Municipality . ORG further held that the applicant ’s complaint could not be considered as a complaint under LAW , since the GPE was no longer competent to issue a decision in the applicant ’s case .

On DATE the applicant constructed a fence around her plot . The following day the fence was demolished by unknown persons . On CARDINAL DATE the GPE ORG discontinued the criminal proceedings , as it had been impossible to find the culprits .

Meanwhile , the GPE Wawer Mayor sent letters to ORG asking for examination of the ORG motions concerning construction on the forest plots in GPE . This was to no avail as the Minister sent the motions back to the GPE .
On DATE the applicant sent a letter to the Mayor of GPE – PERSON asking for an explanation for the delay .

On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG alleging inactivity on the part of the GPE – PERSON . She claimed that despite the final planning permission of DATE and her application of DATE the Municipality had failed to apply to the Governor to alter the use of her plot as specified in the local master plan . On CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint . The court held that the law in force did not oblige the GPE to apply to the Governor , and therefore her complaint should be rejected .

On DATE ORG adopted a resolution and held that the so - called park in GPE should be designated as a district park in the future local master plan . ORG was ordered to institute proceedings in order to buy out the plots from their owners .

On DATE an expert GPE submitted an evaluation report on the value of the applicant ’s plot and the plots of CARDINAL other owners . Subsequently the GPE began negotiating the price with the applicant and other owners of the plots of land in question .
On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint of the ORG against the decision of the local self - government board of DATE .
On DATE the applicant was able to sell the plot in question for MONEY [ approx . QUANTITY ] . The seller and the buyer declared in the notarial deed that the price represented the market price .

Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant lodged a civil action with ORG against GPE asking for payment for the use of the plot without a contractual basis . On DATE she withdrew her action . Consequently , the proceedings were discontinued on DATE .

The provisions relating to the procedure for divesting the applicant ’s plot of its protective forest status were included in the law of CARDINAL DATE on protection of agricultural and forest grounds ( ustawa o ochronie gruntów rolnych i lesnych ) . This law was repealed by the new law of DATE which entered into force on DATE .
